name: test_ggtree_export
script:
#testing ggtree plot export

#test tree plot in Arbor

library("ape")
library("geiger")
library("ggplot2")
library("ggtree")

#set up temporary directory
td<-"/opt/girder/tempdata"
tempPlotFile=paste(td, "/temp.png", sep="")

#primate tree from Jeroen Smaers
primates<-"(((((((Cercopithecus_mitis:6.429209,Cercopithecus_ascanius:6.429209):3.418917,Erythrocebus_patas:9.848126):1.644988,Miopithecus_talapoin:11.493113):3.382065,(Lophocebus_albigena:5.769163,Papio_anubis:5.769163):9.106015):6.535196,(Piliocolobus_badius:15.435157,Nasalis_larvatus:15.435158):5.975217):8.589626,(Hylobates_lar:19.605945,((Gorilla_gorilla_gorilla:8.652233,(Homo_sapiens:6.17588,(Pan_paniscus:2.333553,Pan_troglodytes_troglodytes:2.333553):3.842326):2.476353):6.480222,Pongo_pygmaeus:15.132455):4.473491):10.394055):16.811821,(((Alouatta_seniculus:14.76024,(Ateles_geoffroyi:9.147391,Lagothrix_lagotricha:9.147391):5.612849):6.56106,Cebus_albifrons:21.321301):1.411478,Pithecia_pithecia:22.732779):24.079043);"

#trick for writing and reading newick string from Jeroen Smaers
cat(primates, file = "ex.tre", sep = "\n")
tree<- read.tree("ex.tre")

#plot the tree as an object
plotObject<-ggtree(tree) + geom_tiplab() + xlim(NA, 75)

ggsave(tempPlotFile, device="png", width=5, height=5, plotObject)
bytes <- file.info(tempPlotFile)$size
treePlot <- base64enc:::base64encode(readBin(tempPlotFile,"raw", n = bytes))

#make sure output specified is treePlot as png base64

#clean up the temporary directory
file.remove(tempPlotFile)
file.remove("ex.tre")

#end
